00014 
00015 
00016 /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00017 // CLASS
00018 
00019 /**
00020  * Standard handler for PEAR-based responses from Amazon.
00021  */
00022 class TarzanHTTPResponse
00023 {
00024         /**
00025          * Store HTTP header information.
00026          */
00027         var $header;
00028 
00029         /**
00030          * Store the SimpleXML response.
00031          */
00032         var $body;
00033 
00034         /**
00035          * Store the HTTP response code.
00036          */
00037         var $status;
00038 
00039         /**
00040          * Constructor
00041          *
00042          * Constructs a new instance of the TarzanHTTPResponse class.
00043          *
00044          * @access public
00045          * @param array $header The HTTP headers as returned from AWS by PEAR's HTTP_Request class.
00046          * @param string $body XML content as returned from AWS by PEAR's HTTP_Request class.
00047          * @return object Contains an (array) 'header' property (containing HTTP headers) and a (SimpleXMLElement) 'body' property.
00048          */
00049         public function __construct($header, $body, $status = null)
00050         {
00051                 $this->header = $header;
00052                 $this->body = $body;
00053                 $this->status = $status;
00054 
00055                 if (isset($body))
00056                 {
00057                         // If the response is XML data, parse it.
00058                         if (substr(ltrim($body), 0, 5) == '<?xml')
00059                         {
00060                                 $this->body = new SimpleXMLElement($body);
00061                         }
00062                 }
00063 
00064                 return $this;
00065         }
00066 
00067         /**
00068          * isOK
00069          * 
00070          * Did we receive the status code we expected?
00071          * 
00072          * @param mixed $codes (Optional) The status code(s) to expect. Integer for a single accepted value, or an array of integers for multiple accepted values.
00073          * @return boolean Whether we received the expected code or not.
00074          */
00075         public function isOK($codes = array(200, 204))
00076         {
00077                 if (is_array($codes))
00078                 {
00079                         return in_array($this->status, $codes);
00080                 }
00081                 else
00082                 {
00083                         return ($this->status == $codes);
00084                 }
00085         }
00086 }
00087 ?>
